comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/77190895@N05] Is it Ballyglasheen? No wonder I couldn't find this on any maps!! Thanks a million - have changed the title, etc. and thanks to you, have been able to add it to our Flickr Map.
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 69587809@N05
comment._content: The 'ballagh' or pass is neither gasheen, as suggested, or osheeheen, as titled by Lawrence.  It is Ballaghosheen or  the Pass of Oisin.  It is an alternative route to the Ring of Kerry from Killarney to Waterville which long predates the Ring in importance and features strongly in the tales of the Fianna.  The picture shows a man on his cart heading towards Killarney and inland in general. A warrior of the Fianna, coming in the opposite direction in long and swift strides from great feats in the land of Ireland, would view the sea here for the first time. The view of the sea is distant and constrained by the coastal mountains but after a long journey overland it is an inspiring vista.  Here Oisin stood and saw further than any had ever seen before - to Tír na nÓg surrounded by the foam of the Atlantic but within reach of his white steed. In that land of eternal youth he spent endless happy years, so please retain the meaning in the place name so that one day this land will be found again.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/mosskayree] Happy to oblige, and so I've changed the title! How could I resist such a lyrical description? However, could you give me lat and long co-ordinates for the Pass?
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 69587809@N05
comment._content: It is approximately 51. 79 North and 9. 56 (west) and is to be found in the OSI Discovery Series 79 with the Irish place name Bealach Oisín and the English Ballaghisheen Pass. The road sign has a similar Irish name but renders it Ballaghasheen Pass in English. I cannot say why neither body used 'o' instead of 'i' or 'a' or what strange heat arose from the obvious when it was being grasped.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/mosskayree] My relationship with our Flickr map is going downhill at a rate of knots. While your 51.79, -9.56 easily pops up on Google Maps, on the Flickr map it's saying "Unable to locate that location" and this is happening more and more often... This one'll have to stay where it is for the moment, and I'll wrestle it into submission when I'm back from my holliers...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons
